If we assume that Lisa did not buy the red shirt, then statement 1 is false, because Mark would not have bought the blue shirt if Lisa did not buy the red shirt. However, statement 2 is still true, because Mark did buy the blue shirt regardless of whether Lisa bought the red shirt or not.

On the other hand, if we assume that Lisa did buy the red shirt, then statement 1 is true, because if Lisa bought the red shirt, then Mark must have bought the blue shirt. And statement 2 is also true, because Mark did buy the blue shirt.

Based on the above analysis, we can deduce that the two statements are logically consistent with each other, regardless of whether Lisa bought the red shirt or not. Therefore, we cannot logically deduce that Lisa bought the red shirt based on these two statements alone.
